metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3104 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: mongod in MongoDB 2.6, when using 2.4-style users, and 2.4 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and process termination) by leveraging in-memory database representation when authenticating against a non-existent database.

notes.Note: ratliff> The mongodb advisory recommend upgrading to latest 2.6. No 2.4 patch

criterions.comment: mongodb: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
